subject: Design
title: A/B Testing: Letting Data Decide
description: A fast breakdown of A/B Testing: Letting Data Decide for builders.

hook.text: Google tested 41 shades of blue for one link. The winning shade earned $200 million more per year.

buildup.text: A/B testing shows two versions of a design to different users and measures which performs better.

discovery.text: It removes opinion from design decisions. Data, not the loudest person in the room, wins.

twist.text: Google's relentless testing drove their lead designer to quit, calling the approach 'soulless.'

climax.text: A/B testing is powerful but can't measure everything â€” brand feeling, delight, and long-term trust resist metrics.

punchline.text: Data finds the optimal. Humans find the meaningful.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of A/B testing in UX?
options: To compare two design versions using real user data
